title: NixOS-specific (?) ENOENT in gitsigns after vim.system `clear_env=true` change
body:
### Problem

This only happens on my Linux machine running NixOS, and not on a macOS laptop.

Not sure what's the policy for such problems here. Also not sure if this is a problem on a 'normal' linux machine or not. I'm open to offer any help.

So after updating to 731e616 gitsigns stopped working for me as it throws an error on opening each file:
```
vim.schedule callback: ...unwrapped-nightly/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/_system.lua:249: ENOENT: no such file or directory
stack traceback:
        [thread: 0x7f0cf87ac348] [C]: in function 'asystem'
        [thread: 0x7f0cf87ac348] ...vimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns/git/cmd.lua:58: in function 'git_command'
        [thread: 0x7f0cf87ac348] ...imPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns/git/repo.lua:213: in function 'get_info'
        [thread: 0x7f0cf87ac348] ...ck/myNeovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns.lua:44: in function 'get_gitdir_and_head'
        [thread: 0x7f0cf87ac348] ...ck/myNeovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns.lua:131: in function <...ck/myNeovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns.lua:114>
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'error'
        ...eovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns/async.lua:229: in function '_finish'
        ...eovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns/async.lua:322: in function '_resume'
        ...eovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns/async.lua:317: in function <...eovimPackages/start/gitsigns.nvim/lua/gitsigns/async.lua:307>
```

### Steps to reproduce

Not sure if this is reproducible on a non-NixOS machine. For sure not on darwin.

I can 100% reproduce this on my flake https://github.com/konradmalik/neovim-flake. Steps (require `nix` installed):

- `git clone https://github.com/konradmalik/neovim-flake.git`
- checkout the bad commit: `git reset --hard 5d1f7bcd6a0b34a21b2ea99b95e26dbeee8aa440`
- build and see the error `nix build && ./result/bin/nvim`
- checkout the good commit which rolls the neovim-src back: `git reset --hard 76da3bbdb3ed7327add6ad43b7873bc1b6efd72a`
- build, run, and see all is ok `nix build && ./result/bin/nvim`

### Expected behavior

should not throw errors

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

731e616

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

NixOS

### Terminal name/version

ghostty 1.1.3

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

build from repo
